amendatorysection.para: The short form expression, Specific Authority for Assistants, shall mean that the principal generally authorizes and empowers the agent to compensate and reimburse the expenses of, to employ, engage, or hire, and to discharge or terminate the services of any accountant, advisor, attorney, doctor, expert, or other nonprofessional or professional assistant or consultant appropriate, convenient, or necessary for effectuation of, and otherwise to secure through any assistant any advice or help reasonably useful in the discharge of, any other specific authority or general power granted to the agent by the principal.
